First, thank you so much for the response.  That was a ton of help. 
Just o=
ne more question.  If I already have the jar files and want to
use my local=
 copies, can I just add their location to the
project.properties, or do I a=
lso need to add them to the project.xml file?

--- In archive-crawler@yahoo=
groups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> See the dependencies secti=
on in the project.xml.  If the xmlrpc lib is 
> available up in the maven1 =
ibiblio repository, maven should just fetch 
> it for you (You may need to =
add the following to your
project.properties 
> file because Heritrix is st=
ill stuck on maven 1.0.x: 
> maven.repo.remote=3Dhttp://repo1.maven.org/mav=
en).
> 
> Here is some more info on Heritrix and lib jars in case the above=

proves 
> insufficent.  Heritrix goes out of its way to defeat mavens depe=
ndency 
> fetching mechanism.  It does this by setting 'maven.jar.override =
=3D on' 
> in project.properties and then  mapping project.xml dependency 
=
> references to actual locations under the lib directory (again in 
> proje=
ct.properties).  The thinking at the time was that the Heritrix 
> checkout=
 contained all needed to run in the likes of eclipse.  Maven
was 
> not req=
uired (This will probably change when we move to m2).
> 
> For example, for=
 the libidn jar, in project.xml, it looks like this:
> 
> ...
>         <de=
pendency>
>             <id>libidn</id>
>             <version>0.5.9</versi=
on>
>             <url>http://www.gnu.org/software/libidn/</url>
>         =
    <properties>
>                 <war.bundle>true</war.bundle>
>         =
        <ear.bundle>true</ear.bundle>
>                 <ear.bundle.dir>APP=
-INF/lib</ear.bundle.dir>
>                 <description>GNU Libidn is an i=
mplementation of the 
> Stringprep,
>                 Punycode and IDNA spe=
cifications defined by the IETF
>                 Internationalized Domain =
Names (IDN) working group,
used for
>                 internationalized dom=
ain names.
>                 </description>
>                 <license>GNU =
Lesser General Public License
>                 http://www.gnu.org/licenses=
/lgpl.txt</license>
>             </properties>
>         </dependency>
> .=
..
> 
> The 'id' libidn from above is then mapped in project properties to =
the 
> libidn-0.5.9.jar with the following project.properties line:
> 
> ma=
ven.jar.libidn =3D ${basedir}/lib/libidn-0.5.9.jar
> 
> You might also want=
 to edit .classpath so your new jar shows in eclipse.
> 
> Hope this helps,=

> St.Ack
> 
> 
> Kaleb wrote:
> >
> > I need to add the Apache XMLRPC jars=
 to the Heritrix build, but I have
> > no idea how to add these to Maven. C=
ould someone point me in the
> > right direction or at some pertinent docum=
ents? I've had no problems
> > adding these libs to Netbeans projects, but =
I don't understand the
> > Maven documentation and am floundering.
> >
> > =
Thanks,
> > Kaleb
> >
> >
>
